definition: solemn/reverent/calm/burial position in an ancestral tomb (old)/old variant of 默

sentences.english: A savage howl, like an ominous setting sun, punctured immortality so slimy and solemn.
sentences.chinese: 有狂野的嗥叫像不祥的殘陽擊穿粘稠肅穆的永恆。

sentences.english: After that the generals began to disperse with the solemnity and circumspect taciturnity with which people separate after a funeral.
sentences.chinese: 將軍們隨即莊嚴肅穆地退場，像參加完了葬禮一樣。

sentences.english: Dug activists even disrupted what was to be a placid, respectful funeral for the fallen Moe.
sentences.chinese: 達格族激進分子甚至在莫的肅穆葬禮上挑起騷亂。

sentences.english: Outside the window was the divine night, and the stars in my dream were staring into me.
sentences.chinese: 窗外是肅穆的夜，夢中的寒星與我靜靜地對望。

sentences.english: Look at the red walls and yellow roof. It represents a sense of solemnness and seriousness.
sentences.chinese: 看那紅牆黃頂，處處透露着莊嚴肅穆的感覺。

sentences.english: Huge pine trees stand in solemnness, dark grey rocks are covered by moss.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的松樹在肅穆中挺立，蒼灰色的岩石上爬滿青苔。

sentences.english: Buddha's face by the original cast bronze pieces, the grand and solemn.
sentences.chinese: 佛祖的面龐由原塊青銅鑄造，宏偉肅穆。

sentences.english: The white-clad military band stood to attention.
sentences.chinese: 穿着白色制服的軍樂隊肅穆的站着。

sentences.english: Ceremony was solemn temples burst of music began.
sentences.chinese: 儀式是在一陣莊嚴肅穆的廟堂音樂中開始的。

sentences.english: For this blessing there was a solemn form, but no mortal has heard it;
sentences.chinese: 過去還不曾有人類親耳聽到過這些莊嚴肅穆的祝福。

sentences.english: The entire cemetery in Cangsong Cuibai surrounded in solemn silence.
sentences.chinese: 整個墓地在蒼松翠柏環抱中，莊嚴肅穆。

sentences.english: I lift my heavy heart up solemnly.
sentences.chinese: 我肅穆地捧起我那沉重的心。

sentences.english: The mourning hall was filled with a solemn silence.
The motive behind such words is austere rather than snobbish.
sentences.chinese: 使用這些字樣的動機是莊嚴肅穆而非趨炎附勢。

sentences.english: The president and his wife Michelle stood heads bowed on the South Lawn of the White House.
sentences.chinese: 總統夫婦走出白宮，步上南坪並垂首而立，肅穆默哀。

sentences.english: The moon is a stone; but it is a brightly numinous stone.
sentences.chinese: 圓月宛若磐石，明亮，莊重而肅穆。

definition: untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
simple and unadorned (of art, architecture etc)
gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
to blend into one another/to blend together well
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
